list_definition.definition: a round wheel-shaped or cylindrical object of wood, metal etc on which thread, film, fishing-lines etc can be wound

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He changed the reel in the projector.

list_definition.mean_english: nhạc cho vũ điệu quay ở Scotland…
list_definition.definition: (the music for) a type of lively Scottish, Irish or American dance
to stagger; to sway; to move in an unsteady way

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The drunk man reeled along the road
My brain was reeling with all the information that he gave me.

list_ex_of_english: I do not apologise for reeling off a few statistics.
In fact, it hit them a reeling blow.
In the village you could see shop-window signs from a composer offering, for a fee, strathspeys, reels or airs for your birth, wedding or funeral.
Farmers are reeling from lower prices, but they are also swamped by paperwork.
We should be wary of embarking on actions that would have knock-on consequences across the tourism industry, which is already seriously ailing, if not reeling.
The motorist is still reeling from the massive extra taxes and duties which have been levied since the general election.
How many reels of film are allowed to go to dust?
He reeled off a very long list of similar cases.
